Claim: An image has been shared hundreds of times in multiple posts on Facebook alongside a claim that shows a poster issued by activist group Extinction Rebellion stating “Corona is the cure, humans are the disease.”
Explaination: The claim is false; Extinction Rebellion said that the image was published by an unaffiliated Twitter account and that the poster’s message in “no way” represents the global environmental movement’s “principles and values”.
Label: False
html:
Claim: An image has been shared hundreds of times in multiple posts on Facebook alongside a claim that shows a poster issued by activist group Extinction Rebellion stating “Corona is the cure, humans are the disease.”

Explanation:The claim is false; Extinction Rebellion said that the image was published by an unaffiliated Twitter account and that the poster’s message in “no way” represents the global environmental movement’s “principles and values”.

https://factcheck.afp.com/extinction-rebellion-said-it-did-not-issue-poster-about-coronavirus

Claim: Social media accounts purporting to represent the Nigeria Centre for Disease Control have proliferated since February, when Africa’s most populous country recorded its first case of COVID-19.
Explaination: AFP Fact Check rounds up some of the most popular fake accounts.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Social media accounts purporting to represent the Nigeria Centre for Disease Control have proliferated since February, when Africa’s most populous country recorded its first case of COVID-19.

Explanation:AFP Fact Check rounds up some of the most popular fake accounts.

https://factcheck.afp.com/nigerian-health-authority-denounces-fake-social-media-accounts

Claim: Black body bags being referred to as deaths in New York and the reason a lockdown is essential.
Explaination: The body bags are from Eucador and not New York.
Label: FALSE
html:
Claim: Black body bags being referred to as deaths in New York and the reason a lockdown is essential.

Explanation:The body bags are from Eucador and not New York.

https://www.boomlive.in/fake-news/no-this-video-does-not-show-body-bags-in-a-new-york-hospital-7588?infinitescroll=1

Claim: Coronavirus is infectious in the air for 8 hours and everyone must wear a face mask.
Explaination: Coronavirus may remain in the air 1-3 hours, and face masks are not required for everyone, just healthcare workers.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Coronavirus is infectious in the air for 8 hours and everyone must wear a face mask.

Explanation:Coronavirus may remain in the air 1-3 hours, and face masks are not required for everyone, just healthcare workers.

https://www.factcheck.org/2020/03/posts-distort-facts-on-coronavirus-air-transmission-masks/

Claim: “Confirmed cases” of the novel coronavirus or 2019 nCoV were recorded at the Philippine Bank of Communications (PBCom) Tower in Makati City, according to a message that circulated Friday, Jan. 24.
Explaination: Speaking to reporters on January 24, Health Undersecretary Eric Domingo maintained that there is still no confirmed case of the 2019 nCov in the Philippines. The management of PBCom Tower also said there is “no truth” to the information.
Label: False
html:
Claim: “Confirmed cases” of the novel coronavirus or 2019 nCoV were recorded at the Philippine Bank of Communications (PBCom) Tower in Makati City, according to a message that circulated Friday, Jan. 24.

Explanation:Speaking to reporters on January 24, Health Undersecretary Eric Domingo maintained that there is still no confirmed case of the 2019 nCov in the Philippines. The management of PBCom Tower also said there is “no truth” to the information.

https://www.rappler.com/newsbreak/fact-check/250112-confirmed-cases-coronavirus-pbcom-tower-makati

Claim: Russia has unleashed over 500 lions to ensure that people stay inside their homes amid the coronavirus outbreak.
Explaination: the image of a bulletin viral on social media has nothing to do with Russia or Russian President. The image is from South Africa’s Johannesburg, and the lion seen in the viral image was brought for film shooting by the production crew.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Russia has unleashed over 500 lions to ensure that people stay inside their homes amid the coronavirus outbreak.

Explanation:the image of a bulletin viral on social media has nothing to do with Russia or Russian President. The image is from South Africa’s Johannesburg, and the lion seen in the viral image was brought for film shooting by the production crew.

https://www.newschecker.in/article/news-detail/275_15331931?check=3
ann03_remarks: social alarm (Should'nt we adapt the categories and add this one?)

Claim: Videos state that 25,000 Chinese are being killed.
Explaination: Three different videos - 2 unrelated to the coronavirus and one with overlaid music are clubbed together with false claims.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Videos state that 25,000 Chinese are being killed.

Explanation:Three different videos - 2 unrelated to the coronavirus and one with overlaid music are clubbed together with false claims.

https://www.boomlive.in/fake-news/video-shows-chinese-policemen-killing-coronavirus-patients-factcheck-6885

Claim: There is now a COVID-19 cure from the USA.
Explaination: It was a test kit from South Korea, that was shared as an American-made vaccine for COVID-19.
Label: False
html:
Claim: There is now a COVID-19 cure from the USA.

Explanation:It was a test kit from South Korea, that was shared as an American-made vaccine for COVID-19.

https://srilanka.factcrescendo.com/2020/03/30/fact-check-test-kit-from-south-korea-shared-as-covid19-vaccine/

Claim: Big Pharma is behind COVID-19 deaths.
Explaination: There is absolutely no evidence the "Big Pharma" companies are behind the virus.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Big Pharma is behind COVID-19 deaths.

Explanation:There is absolutely no evidence the "Big Pharma" companies are behind the virus.

https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2020/04/fact-check-10.html

Claim: North Carolina “hospital beds are typically 85% full across the state.”
Explaination: Records show that NC hospitals are, on average throughout the year, between 60-to-75% full. However, medical professionals say Jackson is right that hospitals operate at maximum capacity during certain parts of the year, such as flu season.
Label: Half True
html:
Claim: North Carolina “hospital beds are typically 85% full across the state.”

Explanation:Records show that NC hospitals are, on average throughout the year, between 60-to-75% full. However, medical professionals say Jackson is right that hospitals operate at maximum capacity during certain parts of the year, such as flu season.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/apr/01/jeff-jackson/are-nc-hospital-beds-typically-85-full/

Claim: States are imposing mandatory leave and statewise school closures due to coronavirus.
Explaination: Though schools have closed since this announcement, at the time of its original posting, it was not true.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: States are imposing mandatory leave and statewise school closures due to coronavirus.

Explanation:Though schools have closed since this announcement, at the time of its original posting, it was not true.

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3471856-fact-check-states-are-not-imposing-mandatory-leave-and-statewide-school-closures-due-to-coronavirus.html#live

Claim: Brazilians lighting candles after PM Modi’s call to stand in solidarity against the coronavirus.
Explaination: This event took place in Brazil before PM Modi’s call to stand in solidarity against coronavirus.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Brazilians lighting candles after PM Modi’s call to stand in solidarity against the coronavirus.

Explanation:This event took place in Brazil before PM Modi’s call to stand in solidarity against coronavirus.

https://www.factcrescendo.com/fact-check-brazilians-lighting-candles-after-pm-modis-call-to-stand-in-solidarity-against-coornavirus/

Claim: Photographs of the Army in Dublin city centre show that the country is about to go into lockdown.
Explaination: The photographs show the Army setting up mobile testing centres in Dublin city centre, not preparing for the country to go into lockdown
Label: False
html:
Claim: Photographs of the Army in Dublin city centre show that the country is about to go into lockdown.

Explanation:The photographs show the Army setting up mobile testing centres in Dublin city centre, not preparing for the country to go into lockdown

https://www.thejournal.ie/debunked-coronavirus-testing-facility-dublin-5053846-Mar2020/

Claim: COVID-19 is a hoax or scapegoat for economic disaster.
Explaination: Came from conspiracy-related source and data and many reports worldwide confirm deaths from coronavirus.
Label: False
html:
Claim: COVID-19 is a hoax or scapegoat for economic disaster.

Explanation:Came from conspiracy-related source and data and many reports worldwide confirm deaths from coronavirus.

https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2020/04/fact-check-covid-19-is-not-a-fabrication-or-a-scapegoat-for-economic-disaster.html

Claim: President Rodrigo Duterte said COVID-19, the disease caused by the novel coronavirus, is only transmitted through contact with other people.
Explaination: The novel coronavirus is known to spread mainly from person to person, but it can also spread through infected surfaces or objects.
Label: False
html:
Claim: President Rodrigo Duterte said COVID-19, the disease caused by the novel coronavirus, is only transmitted through contact with other people.

Explanation:The novel coronavirus is known to spread mainly from person to person, but it can also spread through infected surfaces or objects.

https://www.rappler.com/newsbreak/fact-check/255271-coronavirus-transmitted-through-humans-only-duterte

Claim: Infographic claiming that the coronavirus pandemic fits a pattern of viral outbreaks that occur every 100 years.
Explaination: The infographic contains inaccurate information about historical viral outbreaks and ignores other epidemics that do not fit the assumed pattern; health experts told AFP that while certain viruses are seasonal in nature, there is no basis for the claim that viral outbreaks occur once every century.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Infographic claiming that the coronavirus pandemic fits a pattern of viral outbreaks that occur every 100 years.

Explanation:The infographic contains inaccurate information about historical viral outbreaks and ignores other epidemics that do not fit the assumed pattern; health experts told AFP that while certain viruses are seasonal in nature, there is no basis for the claim that viral outbreaks occur once every century.

https://factcheck.afp.com/health-experts-dismiss-false-claim-covid-19-fits-pattern-viral-outbreaks-every-100-years

Claim: In India starting 3/24/20, all grocery, chemists and vegetable shops will be open from 9.00 am to 11.30 am and 4.30 pm to 7.00 pm. Anybody found moving around after this or opening any kind of outlet will be detained by the police. No home deliveries will be available.
Explaination: Delhi Police has clarified that the viral message on social media is Fake.
Label: False
html:
Claim: In India starting 3/24/20, all grocery, chemists and vegetable shops will be open from 9.00 am to 11.30 am and 4.30 pm to 7.00 pm. Anybody found moving around after this or opening any kind of outlet will be detained by the police. No home deliveries will be available.

Explanation:Delhi Police has clarified that the viral message on social media is Fake.

https://english.factcrescendo.com/2020/03/24/fact-check-no-necessities-available-post-lockdown/

Claim: Taking a hot bath is an effective remedy against COVID-19.
Explaination: Health experts say there is no scientific evidence that bathing in hot water can prevent people from catching the virus; the World Health Organisation (WHO) warned that bathing or showering in very hot water can be “harmful”.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: Taking a hot bath is an effective remedy against COVID-19.

Explanation:Health experts say there is no scientific evidence that bathing in hot water can prevent people from catching the virus; the World Health Organisation (WHO) warned that bathing or showering in very hot water can be “harmful”.

https://factcheck.afp.com/experts-refute-misleading-claim-bathing-hot-water-can-prevent-covid-19

Claim: Weed, slang for the cannabis plant, can “kill coronavirus.”
Explaination: As of Tuesday, February 18, the World Health Organization (WHO) said "there is still no specific medicine recommended to prevent or treat" the novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV).
Label: False
html:
Claim: Weed, slang for the cannabis plant, can “kill coronavirus.”

Explanation:As of Tuesday, February 18, the World Health Organization (WHO) said "there is still no specific medicine recommended to prevent or treat" the novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV).

https://www.rappler.com/newsbreak/fact-check/252096-cannabis-kills-coronavirus

Claim: Gargling water with salt or vinegar “eliminates” the coronavirus.
Explaination: There is no known treatment for the new coronavirus,according to WHO.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Gargling water with salt or vinegar “eliminates” the coronavirus.

Explanation:There is no known treatment for the new coronavirus,according to WHO.

https://www.factcheck.org/2020/03/gargling-water-with-salt-wont-eliminate-coronavirus/

Claim: “Queen Elizabeth tests positive for COVID-19.”
Explaination: No credible reports claim that Queen Elizabeth II tested positive for COVID-19. Buckingham Palace recently said she remains in good health.
Label: False
html:
Claim: “Queen Elizabeth tests positive for COVID-19.”

Explanation:No credible reports claim that Queen Elizabeth II tested positive for COVID-19. Buckingham Palace recently said she remains in good health.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/apr/02/blog-posting/no-reports-queen-elizabeth-tested-positive-covid-1/

Claim: Joe Biden tested positive for coronavirus.
Explaination: Another news publication refuted the false claim.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Joe Biden tested positive for coronavirus.

Explanation:Another news publication refuted the false claim.

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3472020-Fact-Check-Joe-Biden-Did-NOT-Test-Positive-For-Coronavirus-As-African-Hoax-Website-Claims.html

Claim: The Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security Act gives members of Congress a pay increase.
Explaination: No version of the coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security Act grant pay raises for members of Congress.
Label: Pants on Fire!
html:
Claim: The Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security Act gives members of Congress a pay increase.

Explanation:No version of the coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security Act grant pay raises for members of Congress.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/30/facebook-posts/congress-did-not-give-itself-raise-coronavirus-sti/

Claim: News channels suggest drinking tulsi and noni juice will help prevent the novel coronavirus.
Explaination: A morphed screenshot of the news channel was used.
Label: False
html:
Claim: News channels suggest drinking tulsi and noni juice will help prevent the novel coronavirus.

Explanation:A morphed screenshot of the news channel was used.

https://www.boomlive.in/fake-news/morphed-screenshots-of-aaj-tak-make-false-claims-about-coronavirus-cure-7194

Claim: A Saudi Arabian study for a MERS vaccine is linked to the outbreak of coronavirus.
Explaination: Based on the evidence, AAP FactCheck found the Facebook post to be false. The Saudi clinical trial is investigating a vaccine for the MERS coronavirus strain, not the 2019 Novel coronavirus.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A Saudi Arabian study for a MERS vaccine is linked to the outbreak of coronavirus.

Explanation:Based on the evidence, AAP FactCheck found the Facebook post to be false. The Saudi clinical trial is investigating a vaccine for the MERS coronavirus strain, not the 2019 Novel coronavirus.

https://factcheck.aap.com.au/social-media-claims/saudi-mers-vaccine-study-is-not-related-to-2020-coronavirus-outbreak
